title: change in block gas limit causes loss of consensus
body:
**Description**
While processing shyft mainnet chain from the beginning, nethermind 1.20.3, block processor loses consensus as soon as the block gas limit changed.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Sync Shyft chain from beginning. Any archive mode.   Nethermind [config template](https://github.com/shyftfederation/ansible-playbooks/blob/main/assets/nethermind.cfg.j2), [chainspec](https://spec.shyft.network/ShyftMainnet-current.json), [static nodes](https://spec.shyft.network/static-nodes-ipv4.json).

At block 4431021 per our chainspec there is a change to the block gas limit, identifying a contract that returns a constant.

Bug occurs in linux-arm64-1.20.3 official build from releases page.

Downgrading to 1.19.3 - no problem at this block. Processing continues normally.


**Actual behavior**

```
Processed     4430410...  4430777 |    705.72 ms  | slot   1,014 ms     | Gas gwei: 0.00 .. 0.00 (0.00) .. 0.00
- Blocks              1.37 MGas   |     65    txs | calls    368 (  0)  | sload  13,055 | sstore  1,840 | create   0
- Block throughput    1.93 MGas/s |     92.10 t/s |          521.45 b/s | recv        0 | proc        1
Block gas limit was changed from 10000000 to 40000000.
Processed     4430778...  4431022 |    694.12 ms  | slot   1,003 ms     | Gas gwei: 0.00 .. 0.00 (0.00) .. 0.00
- Blocks              0.99 MGas   |     47    txs | calls    245 (  0)  | sload   8,714 | sstore  1,234 | create   0
- Block throughput    1.42 MGas/s |     67.71 t/s |          352.96 b/s | recv        0 | proc       10
Processed block 4431025 (0x36b538...cb2871) is invalid:
- hash: expected 0xca517716bf5ea33db1af7a3a5cb667d62aa78a4b6bec3a09a2e04371b6a73145, got 0x36b5387aae28ede9eed2b6e688d8b0edb52628453b05ddeecd6bee80d0cb2871
- gas used: expected 50388, got 49344 (diff: -1044)
- receipts root: expected 0xc07bef762118c70cb5eb4800a3eaf3f370e0e700cec691be181475f2c503beef, got 0x5cac4c16400e8ebb88bb84cc65fed87d20b0d24a2ee04dd8d7333f476aa75142
- state root: expected 0x7bd01fdc0cb6b366fba26d896a3616997c2711bab70856bf6c34af47c3cc3ed2, got 0x7fe05cdef5fdc676a9b29b54215df5242ec8771feba3297f692183bcabc699e4
Processed block is not valid 4431025 (0xca517716bf5ea33db1af7a3a5cb667d62aa78a4b6bec3a09a2e04371b6a73145)
Suggested block TD: 1507799674885851355067799469895350738832750640, Suggested block IsPostMerge False, Block TD: 1507799674885851355067799469895350738832750640, Block >
Current contract validators (19): [0x61e952deeedd57e54a057fd5c612e7baf2dd5d09, 0x9435ca62d3b1341631fbe3d545e5e41ef9975c6f, 0xadd60cac91853ff3393e79af171027e38d03e9dc, >
Processed block 4431025 (0x36b538...cb2871) is invalid:
- hash: expected 0xca517716bf5ea33db1af7a3a5cb667d62aa78a4b6bec3a09a2e04371b6a73145, got 0x36b5387aae28ede9eed2b6e688d8b0edb52628453b05ddeecd6bee80d0cb2871
- gas used: expected 50388, got 49344 (diff: -1044)
- receipts root: expected 0xc07bef762118c70cb5eb4800a3eaf3f370e0e700cec691be181475f2c503beef, got 0x5cac4c16400e8ebb88bb84cc65fed87d20b0d24a2ee04dd8d7333f476aa75142
- state root: expected 0x7bd01fdc0cb6b366fba26d896a3616997c2711bab70856bf6c34af47c3cc3ed2, got 0x7fe05cdef5fdc676a9b29b54215df5242ec8771feba3297f692183bcabc699e4
Processed block is not valid 4431025 (0xca517716bf5ea33db1af7a3a5cb667d62aa78a4b6bec3a09a2e04371b6a73145)
Suggested block TD: 1507799674885851355067799469895350738832750640, Suggested block IsPostMerge False, Block TD: 1507799674885851355067799469895350738832750640, Block >
Created a Receipts trace of block 0xca517716bf5ea33db1af7a3a5cb667d62aa78a4b6bec3a09a2e04371b6a73145 in file /tmp/receipts_0xca517716bf5ea33db1af7a3a5cb667d62aa78a4b6b>
Deleting an invalid block or its descendant 0xb4949293aa18427d17a8d8a73a1f635b44699d2fb06c83a216668bcd67327b70

... etc, etc
```

We have observed this issue happening with other 1.19.3 installs, but only on sealers.  The ones not mining completed a sync successfully.

Downgraded my sealer to 1.18.2, also failed to handle the change in block reward.

Attempting anew with 1.17.

I have continued against this problem. The problem really makes no sense.   A tale of two machines. Both machines are running 1.20.3. The difference between the two machines is the chainspec they are running, machine B identifies a fork that is due to happen in a few weeks.

This is the diff in chainspec:
```
# diff chainspec.json  /opt/nm/chainspec.json 
64c64,77
<         "eip2200Transition": "4431021"
---
>         "eip2200Transition": "4431021",
>         "eip1559Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip1884Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip2028Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip2200Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip2565Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip2929Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip2930Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip3198Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip3529Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip3541Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip3651Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip3855Transition": "12721774",
>         "eip3860Transition": "12721774"
```

ie the entirety of the chainspec diff is regarding future enabling of features.

Machine A completes a full sync of the chain, whereas machine B does not (error log below)

If I revise the chainspec on machine B to match that of A, it will continue syncing the chain.  If I set the chainspec back (to re-enable the future fork), it will sync a few thousand blocks and then sooner or later:

````

ðŸ™„ The problem was in my chainspec. Same EIP with different block #'s. What a head-slappingly silly mistake.  Thank you for indulging me.
